case_vignette: a 43-year-old female presents to clinic for evaluation of hair loss along the frontal scalp ongoing over the past year. she reports a twenty year long history of wearing a wig daily and secures her hair in place with tight headband underneath. she denies any significant pain or pruritus in the areas of hair loss. she has tried numerous over the counter oils and shampoos without any improvement. physical examination reveals significant hair thinning an regression of the hairline with preservation of the hair follicles along the frontotemporal scalp. no significant perifollicular erythema is appreciated.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing hair loss along the front part of my scalp for the past year.
How old are you and what is your gender?
I am a 43-year-old female.
Have you noticed any changes in your menstrual cycle or any signs of hormonal imbalance?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my menstrual cycle or signs of hormonal imbalance.
Are there any other areas where you are experiencing hair thinning, such as the eyebrows or body hair?
No, the hair thinning is only occurring along the frontal scalp.
Do you have any family members who have experienced similar hair loss patterns?
No, I don't have any family members who have experienced similar hair loss patterns.
Have you been under significant stress or had any major dietary changes in the past year?
No, I haven't been under significant stress or had any major dietary changes in the past year.
Have you used any new hair care products or treatments that could possibly contribute to the hair loss?
I have tried numerous over-the-counter oils and shampoos, but they have not improved the situation.
Final Diagnosis: Androgenetic Alopecia
